channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand
item.description: There have been just two new cases of Covid-19 reported in the past 24 hours, the Health Ministry has revealed.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 29 April
item.description: There were 742 complaints of businesses not complying with the rules on the first day of alert level 3, most over the lack of social distancing. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest.

item.title: South Taranaki checkpoint discovers many flouting level 3 rules
item.description: Iwi volunteers at a new checkpoint in South Taranaki say the occupants of hundreds of vehicles they stopped did not meet the criteria to be driving under level 3.

item.title: Stolen Jucy rental cars left unlocked with keys inside, police say
item.description: The 112 Jucy rental cars stolen by "opportunists" were left unlocked in a yard - so far, only 69 have been recovered.

item.title: Sisters appeal for isolation exemption to see dying mother
item.description: Two sisters who have flown from Melbourne to be with their dying mother are asking for an exemption so they can leave quarantine early, but say the process has been unwieldy and slow.

item.title: Man accused of coughing at woman charged
item.description: A 21-year-old man accused of coughing at a woman out walking in Alexandra has been arrested.

item.title: Covid-19: 'New Zealand's response has been one of the strongest' - WHO
item.description: The World Health Organisation says New Zealand has been world-leading in its response to Covid-19. But at the same time, a top official for the organisation is warning against complacency.

item.title: Two thirds of renters struggling, says new report
item.description: A survey of almost 2000 tenants by Renters United shows that two thirds had lost at least a third of their income under lockdown and 92 percent of those with reduced incomes were still paying full rent.

item.title: Whakaari/White Island rocks may hold clues to eruption risk - research
item.description: Unique, cracked rocks on Whakaari/White Island allow gas to escape, easing the build-up of pressure that triggers volcanic eruptions, but can become clogged and act like valves.

item.title: Southern DHB 'confident' transmission from Bluff cluster stopped
item.description: One of the country's worst-hit regions for Covid-19 is confident it has turned a corner. There are just 14 active cases in the Southern DHB compared with 101 a couple of weeks ago.

item.title: Wellingtonians 'amped' to return to work in level 3
item.description: Wellington locals say they are excited to get back to work while ensuring that 2-metre distance.

item.title: Covid-19 confusion causing complications for STD sufferers
item.description: People with sexually transmitted infections are delaying seeking help, which is leading to serious complications in some cases.

item.title: Ashley Bloomfield: Activity increase at 'expected levels'
item.description: The increase of New Zealanders congregating at level 3 appears to be at expected levels, not worrying levels, Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield says.

item.title: Victoria University considers 20% pay cuts due to Covid-19 losses
item.description: Victoria University is considering slashing staff pay by a fifth or moving them to a four-day week to help it cope with a forecast $50m drop in income, while Lincoln University is asking staff for a 5 percent pay cut.

item.title: Auckland schools to see high number of students return in level 3
item.description: The Education Ministry has been told 42,853 children will be returning to partially reopened schools and early learning services today.

item.title: Rural broadband network gets $15m investment
item.description: The government has allocated up to $15 million to improve rural broadband capacity.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 28 April
item.description: New Zealand moved down to alert level 3, with some businesses reopening, and restaurant takeaways brought hope to many looking for some respite from daily cooking.

item.title: Five more arrests over theft of Jucy rental vans
item.description: A total of 19 people have now been arrested after the theft of 112 Jucy rental vehicles from an Auckland yard.
